abstract: Former New York Mets outfielder Lenny Dykstra changes his plea from not guilty to no contest on charges of auto theft and providing a false financial statement; Dykstra and two co-defendants are accused of trying to lease and then sell cars from several dealerships by claiming credit though a phony business; other baseball news noted.
snippet: The former Mets outfielder Lenny Dykstra has changed his plea from not guilty to no contest on charges of auto theft and providing a false financial statement.
lead_paragraph: The former Mets outfielder Lenny Dykstra has changed his plea from not guilty to no contest on charges of auto theft and providing a false financial statement.
